context.arch.storage
Class Condition

java.lang.Object
  context.arch.storage.Condition

 class Condition
extends java.lang.Object

This class is a container for a condition attribute, comparison and value. A Condition is used to specify what data a component is interested in, in the case of a poll/subscribe/retrieval. It is meant to help a component more easily get the data it is interested in. Each Condition has the name of an attribute, a comparison operator, and a value. For example, an application may only want to know about temperature changes when the temperature is above 20 degrees. It would set a condition on its subscription, where the attribute name was "temperature", operator was ">", and value was "20". Conditions are a collection of AND'ed Condition statements.
